column4: hi all :) brand new ubuntu user here, installed 9.10 Server on brand new hardware, can't get networking going. it is physically linked by ethernet to my router, the light on the mobo is green, the cable check in the BIOS runs successfully. any idea where to start?
open up a terminal, type 'ifconfig' and tell us what's there (if necessary, copy it to pastebin.ca manually)
ipconfig is for dos.  try ifconfig :)
at least, tell me if it lists eth0 (or something similar)
if you type ifconfig afterwards, does eth0 appear?
oh, sorry, you might need to do sudo.  'sudo ifconfig eth0 up'
type 'iwconfig'.  What does it say for eth1?
I'm not sure if ubuntu has dhcpcd... try running 'dhcpcd eth1'
try unplugging and replugging the ethernet cable
